description.S1: Phyllis is one of the four people Silas sent you to collect from.
description.S2: She works as a supervisor in the Edgewater cannery.

blurb.B1: Phyllis Granger can be found at the Saltuna Cannery, on the upper ramparts.
blurb.B2: She is the foreman and not a pleasant conversationalist,
blurb.B3: so get to the point and ask her about the gravesite fees.
blurb.B5: You will notice that the papers are not signed in her name.
blurb.B6: She will reveal she's paying for one of her worker's grave.
blurb.B7: Since Eugene "vandalized company property" by killing himself,
blurb.B8: Phyllis has to pay for discovering it.

description.S1: You finished collecting gravesite fees from the people of Edgewater.

blurb.B1: After gathering all the gravesite fees,
blurb.B2: return to Silas to receive a reward of 300 bits.
blurb.B3: With a Persuade 6 check, Silas will agree to upping the reward by 150 bits.

dialog.speaker: PhyllisGranger (Female)
dialog.utterance: You the new worker?

dialog.speaker: PhyllisGranger (Female)
dialog.utterance: Whatever. Make it quick, tenderfoot. I'm busy.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'm guessing you're the foreman.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Gravesite fees. I'm here to collect.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'll let you get back to work.

dialog.speaker: PhyllisGranger (Female)
dialog.utterance: Foreman Granger. Mind those words don't come out of your mouth unless preceded by "Yes," or "Right away," or "Thank you."

dialog.speaker: PhyllisGranger (Female)
dialog.utterance: Shit. Silas still on about that? Here, take the fees. I'd appreciate it if you didn't tell Reed I was late on my payment.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: These papers aren't signed in your name.

dialog.speaker: PhyllisGranger (Female)
dialog.utterance: Because they're not my fees and not my gravesite. Guy I worked with shot himself. I paid the bill.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: That's kind of you. I guess.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You have to pay for your neighbor's gravesite fees?

dialog.speaker: PhyllisGranger (Female)
dialog.utterance: I could do without the sarcasm. Wasn't acting out of the goodness of my heart.

dialog.speaker: PhyllisGranger (Female)
dialog.utterance: Law requires delinquent gravesite fees to be paid by the deceased party's closest living relative. Which meant me.

dialog.speaker: PhyllisGranger (Female)
dialog.utterance: Shame, though. Eugene was a good worker.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You said this guy shot himself?

dialog.speaker: PhyllisGranger (Female)
dialog.utterance: Woke up one morning and put a round through his upper story. Can't imagine why. The kid was doing all right at his desk. We all thought he was an upstanding receptionist.

dialog.speaker: PhyllisGranger (Female)
dialog.utterance: Just between the two of us, I'm pretty shocked his weapon didn't misfire. Spacer's Choice handguns aren't the most reliable.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: That's an awful thing to say.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Must be tough losing family.

dialog.speaker: PhyllisGranger (Female)
dialog.utterance: Not half as awful as the bill Eugene left us with.

dialog.speaker: PhyllisGranger (Female)
dialog.utterance: Suicide's a crime. The legal term is irreparable damage to company property. What Eugene did to himself was vandalism.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You can't be serious.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: What are they gonna do? Arrest his corpse?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Vandalism, huh? Did you have to clean bits of him off the wall or something?

dialog.speaker: PhyllisGranger (Female)
dialog.utterance: I'm plenty serious. In fact I'm a little upset Eugene didn't think things through.

dialog.speaker: PhyllisGranger (Female)
dialog.utterance: In other words, Edgewater would've been penalized pretty hard. Whatever Eugene was worth as an asset, we would've had to pay out of pocket to Spacer's Choice.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: He was a person, not an asset.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Would've? You didn't?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: This Eugene guy sounds like he was more trouble than he's worth.

dialog.speaker: PhyllisGranger (Female)
dialog.utterance: Well excuse you. I'll have you know Eugene was an asset to us all. May his atoms be commended to the Law.

dialog.speaker: PhyllisGranger (Female)
dialog.utterance: All I know is Silas asked me for Eugene's gravesite fees. Which means he was approved for burial. Which means his papers went through. Which means the town's in the clear.

dialog.speaker: PhyllisGranger (Female)
dialog.utterance: I'm just glad to put this whole ugly affair behind me. Eugene can rest his bones in peace. And the rest of us can get on with our own lives.

dialog.speaker: PhyllisGranger (Female)
dialog.utterance: Look around. Edgewater ain't exactly swimming in luxury. We can't afford to pay the body-price of a suicide.

dialog.speaker: PhyllisGranger (Female)
dialog.utterance: When one of your workers commits a crime, the entire town pays for it.

dialog.speaker: PhyllisGranger (Female)
dialog.utterance: First of all, that's a horrible thing to say. Secondly, yes, we did.

dialog.speaker: PhyllisGranger (Female)
dialog.utterance: Eugene wasn't family.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I thought you said you were his closest living relative.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: That's an awful thing to say about your closest relative.

dialog.speaker: PhyllisGranger (Female)
dialog.utterance: Yeah. I was the closest living person relative to his body at time of death. I'm the one who found him, you see. So I pay the fines.

dialog.speaker: PhyllisGranger (Female)
dialog.utterance: If you're not familiar with Board law, you oughta be.
